to.sven.androidrccar.host.accessorycommunication.command

Class AbstractCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • to.sven.androidrccar.host.accessorycommunication.command.AbstractCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractCommandWithOkResponse, GetBatteryStateCommand, GetFeaturesCommand, GetProtocolVersionCommand

    public abstract class AbstractCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Abstract implementation for a command that should be send to the µController. The implementation provides sending of the command and receiving the response. It also handles the exceptional response types and the IO exception handling.
    Author:
    sven

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Sends the command; receives and processes the response. If a exception occurs, it will be delegated to IAccessoryCommunicationListener.connectionProblem(to.sven.androidrccar.host.accessorycommunication.exception.AccessoryConnectionProblemException).
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

                  throws java.io.IOException

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - A exception occurs on write.

        Parameters:

      • receiveAndProcessResponse

        private void receiveAndProcessResponse()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the response from the InputStream, validates it, and processes it depending on the received type.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Something is wrong with the connection or the received message.

      • validateMessage

        private void validateMessage(byte[] responseBuffer)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Calculates a CRC8 Checksum of the first 15 bytes and check if it equals with last byte (the checksum byte).
        Parameters:
        responseBuffer - The complete response
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Is thrown if the validation failed.

      • getPayload

                             byte[] responseBuffer)
        Extract the payload and and wrap it into a ByteBuffer
        Parameters:
        responseMessage - The type with the payload length
        responseBuffer - The complete response
        Returns:
        The payload

      • receiveResponse

        private byte[] receiveResponse()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Receives the response message from the µController.
        Returns:
        The complete response
        Throws:

      • mapResponseMessage

        private ResponseMessage mapResponseMessage(byte[] responseBuffer)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Maps the response byte to a ResponseMessage.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A ResponseMessage
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the response byte contains a unknown response message type.

      • processBatteryNearEmpty

        private void processBatteryNearEmpty()
